questions.question: ………………………. we leave now, we will miss the bus home.
questions.description: Unless expresses a condition. It is similar to if...not....

questions.question: ………………………. you like it or not, you are not wearing that skirt to school.
…………………………. he didn’t want me to know the truth, I found out any way.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: I couldn’t enjoy the outing ………………………. it was too cold.
………………………… he had bet on the wrong horse, he lost a lot of money.
questions.description: Either as or since can be used here.

questions.question: He couldn’t buy the ring ………………………….. he didn’t have enough money.
The streets were wet ………………………….. it rained last night.
questions.description: Either for or because can be used here.

questions.question: ……………………….. you are late to bed, you will feel sleepy in the morning.
………………………… you leave office a little early today, we cannot go to movies.
………………………… I were you, I would not go there all alone.
…………………….. she was not there, I spoke to her mother.
He finished first ……………………….. he started late.
questions.description: Either though or although is possible here.
